config.question: President Ronald Reagan based his economic policy on __________.

answer_3.response: Consider This: When Ronald Reagan took office in January 1981, inflation had devastated the economy. He blamed “the worst economic mess since the Great Depression” on high federal spending and excessive taxation. “Government is not the solution to our problems,” Reagan announced in his inaugural address. “Government is the problem.” He believed enacting tax cuts to benefit the private sector would lead to an economic boom. See L.O. 31.5 The Reagan Revolution.
